--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Hesam" <hesi21@...> wrote:
Hesam:

Another=
 (not very elegant) option would be to use the Fortran 'System' 
library ro=
utine to execute python scripts that interact with Cantera.  
Using this me=
thod, you would need to have Fortran write a text file 
containing the 'arg=
uments' to the python script.  The python script 
would read the file, setu=
p Cantera to run a simulation. The script 
would need to write results to a=
nother text file that you then read in 
your Fortran program.

A colleague =
did this for testing using Cantera in a commercial 
application.
>

rof. Goodwin
> Now I am using Compaq Visual Fortran 6.5 developing code for=
 
combustion

1.2 don't

currently

compiler
